introduction.p: This Service Bulletin (SB) provides information on the necessary modifications to be made to the bike's wheel axis. The modifications are required to ensure the safety and performance of the bike.

detail.name: Fork
detail.description: The fork is a critical component of the bike's suspension system. It is responsible for absorbing shocks and maintaining the bike's stability.

detail.name: Spacer
detail.description: The spacer is used to adjust the distance between the fork and the wheel axis.

detail.name: Wheel Axis
detail.description: The wheel axis is the main shaft that connects the wheel to the bike's frame.

detail.name: Conical Expansion Washer
detail.description: The conical expansion washer is used to secure the wheel axis in place.

accomplishmentInstructions.instruction: The modification should be carried out by a qualified technician. The instructions for the modification can be found in the referenced document: DMC-S1000DBIKE

additionalInformation.p: This SB includes examples of formerly not used elements, such as the Terminology Reference (TRM-ACR0001). These elements are used to provide additional context and clarity to the information presented in this SB.

terminologyReference.description: The Terminology Reference is a document that provides definitions and explanations for technical terms used in the bike industry. It is an essential resource for technicians and mechanics who work on bikes.

notes.note: This SB is subject to change without notice.
The information presented in this SB is for general guidance only and should not be considered as a substitute for proper training and experience.
The manufacturer reserves the right to modify or update the information presented in this SB at any time.
